title: The Silence Between Stars
premise: A lone maintenance technician on a deep-space communications buoy discovers the universe-wide network has gone silent not due to malfunction, but because something has systematically silenced every transmitting species. Now, the entity that hunts by the vibrations of thought itself has detected her solitary, pulsing mind in the void. Her only hope is to remain perfectly, utterly still—in both body and consciousness—while she drifts helplessly toward a dead star.
protagonist: Elara Vance, a reclusive 'void-tech' with severe anxiety who sought the solitude of deep space, only to find a terror that preys on the isolated.
conflict: Elara must survive an unknowable cosmic entity that is drawn to and consumes conscious thought, forcing her into an impossible battle of mental attrition against her own mind's need to process fear, while her life support slowly fails.
setting: The G-77 'Hermes' Class Communications Buoy, adrift in the interstellar void between star systems, in a technologically advanced but lonely future.
tone: Claustrophobic, existential dread punctuated by bursts of sublime cosmic terror; a slow-burn psychological nightmare against an infinite, silent backdrop.
